intro: Hippocrepis alpestris, commonly known as the alpine scabious, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. Hippocrepis alpestris plays a role in supporting pollinators and is often found in rocky or meadow-like environments.
